Issues.Title: I can't set up a new rails project with tailwind-css
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/8915
Originally posted by **deyemiobaa** July 21, 2022 Hello, I'm trying to set up a new rails project with `rails new my_app --css tailwind` && `rails new my_app --css=tailwind` but I keep getting an error ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55185309/180105856-9ccf9863-e711-4f00-af84-12420a0110f1.png) This same error also exists if I try to add tailwind-CSS manually using the steps specified in the documentation ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55185309/180106000-913b8f61-3599-499e-aebb-47fe4b527e46.png) I use a Windows 10 PC
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "I can't set up a new rails project with tailwind-css" (#8916)

Issues.Title: ADDING BACKGROUND IMAGE TO STATIC HOSTED PAGE
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/8912
Originally posted by **thrila** July 20, 2022 I added a background image in my project and it worked on the live version i then ran `npm build && npm export ` and made the site live on github when the site became live the rest of my CSS worked but my image wouldn't work the way i imported inserted the image is `background-image: url('../public/image 2.PNG'); `
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ADDING BACKGROUND IMAGE TO STATIC HOSTED PAGE" (#8913)

Issues.Title: Custom variant utilities sometimes incorrectly get prefixed
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.1.6 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Laravel Mix **What version of Node.js are you using?** v16.15.1 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/crlyVAimAY **Describe your issue** First thing to mention, we use a `prefix` of `tw-`. We have created a custom variant called `lighthub`. This variant only gets applied when a parent element has the class `.tw-lighthub` applied e.g. ```html
Lorem ispum
``` The above example works absolutely fine, but we have just come across a situation that didn't work. ```html
Lorem ispum
``` In the above example, the `tw-space-y-6` was not being applied. When we looked at the generated CSS, we can see the following... ```css .tw-lighthub .tw-lighthub\:tw-space-y-6 > :not([hidden]) ~ :not([hidden]) { --tw-space-y-reverse: 0; margin-top: calc(1.5rem * calc(1 - var(--tw-space-y-reverse))); margin-bottom: calc(1.5rem * var(--tw-space-y-reverse)); } .tw-lighthub .lighthub\:tw-bg-slate-400 { --tw-bg-opacity: 1; background-color: rgb(148 163 184 / var(--tw-bg-opacity)); } ``` It seems that the `lighthub` variant is being incorrectly prefixed for the `tw-space-y-6` utility. This is what our `addVariant` plugin looks like. ```javascript plugins: [ plugin(function ({ addVariant, e }) { addVariant('lighthub', ({ modifySelectors, separator }) => { modifySelectors(({ className }) => { const element = e(`lighthub${separator}${className}`); return `.lighthub .${element}`; }); }); }) ], ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom variant utilities sometimes incorrectly get prefixed" (#8906)

Issues.Title: Tailwindcss Standalone CLI 3.1.6 does not seem to work
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Tailwindcss version 3.1.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Standalone CLI under Tailwindcss version 3.1.6

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

Not Applicable

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome, Firefox

**What operating system are you using?**

Window 10

**Reproduction URL**

Have attached a zip file containing the code
[tailwindcss.zip](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/files/9149099/tailwindcss.zip)


**Describe your issue**

I tried using the Standalone CLI as suggested. Initially when i define the page and tailwind details and generated the css style sheet using the tailwindcss.exe, it all seems to work great. The problem came when i changed any of the classes, especially color related. The page display incorrect contents in the styling. The change only gets applied after the generate the style sheet again using tailwindcss.exe.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwindcss Standalone CLI 3.1.6 does not seem to work" (#8905)

Issues.Title: Add `touch` and `no-touch` variants
Issues.Body:
Hi This PR adds `touch` and `no-touch` variants to detect if the device is touch-enabled. It uses [`(hover: hover) & (hover: none)`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/hover), but I can change the media query to use [`(pointer: fine)` & `(pointer: coarse)`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/pointer). ```html

Use your mouse wheel to zoom.

Use pinch to zoom.

``` Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add `touch` and `no-touch` variants" (#8907)

Issues.Title: Update jest-diff: 28.1.1 ‚Üí 28.1.3 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è jest-diff (28.1.1 ‚Üí 28.1.3) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/facebook/jest) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/facebook/jest/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

28.1.3

Features

  • [jest-leak-detector] Use native FinalizationRegistry when it exists to get rid of external C dependency (#12973)

Fixes

  • [jest-changed-files] Fix a lock-up after repeated invocations (#12757)
  • [@jest/expect-utils] Fix deep equality of ImmutableJS OrderedSets (#12977)
  • [jest-mock] Add index signature support for spyOn types (#13013, #13020)
  • [jest-snapshot] Fix indentation of awaited inline snapshots (#12986)

Chore & Maintenance

  • [*] Replace internal usage of pretty-format/ConvertAnsi with jest-serializer-ansi-escapes (#12935, #13004)
  • [docs] Update spyOn docs (#13000)

New Contributors

  • @joshkel made their first contribution in #12960
  • @enrilzhou made their first contribution in #12973
  • @milahu made their first contribution in #12983
  • @MiguelYax made their first contribution in #13000
  • @kaffarell made their first contribution in #13015
  • @TheKhanj made their first contribution in #12988
  • @Fdawgs made their first contribution in #13019

Full Changelog: v28.1.2...v28.1.3

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 34 commits:

  • v28.1.3
  • chore: update changelog for release
  • chore: update docusaurus (#13021)
  • refactor(jest-mock): simplify `PropertyLikeKeys` utility type (#13020)
  • fix: missing spaces in string concats (#13019)
  • chore: bump `typescript` and related dependencies (#13017)
  • Update JestCommunity.md (#12988)
  • chore: update react-native example (#13016)
  • chore: fixed changelog.md typo (#13015)
  • chore: update babel
  • chore: update lint dependencies (#13014)
  • Update spyOn docs (#13000)
  • Refine babel-plugin-jest-hoist typings (#13011)
  • fix(jest-mock): add index signature support for `spyOn` types (#13013)
  • fix(scripts): also check for package.json (#12983)
  • chore: bump `jest-serialiser-ansi-escapes` (#13004)
  • chore: replace `pretty-format/ConvertAnsi` with `jest-serializer-ansi-escapes` (#12935)
  • docs: minor grammar correction from "as document" to "as documented" (#12995)
  • Correct `await`-ed inline snapshot indentation (#12986)
  • feat(jest-leak-detector): use FinalizationRegistry when it exists to get rid of external dependency (#12973)
  • chore: bump `jest-runner-tsd` (#12981)
  • fix: Switch from throat to p-limit (#12960)
  • feat: upgrade TypeBox (#12979)
  • fix(expect-utils): Fix equalityof ImmutableJS OrderedSets (#12977)
  • chore: update lockfile after release
  • v28.1.2
  • chore: update changelog for release
  • chore: update `docusaurus` to `beta.21` (#12955)
  • chore: update `@sinonjs/fake-timers` (#12956)
  • chore: update `v8-to-istanbul` (#12954)
  • fix(jest-runtime): avoid star type import from `@jest/globals` (#12949)
  • docs: testSequencer example use destructured arguments (#12915)
  • Mention Sinon is now supported by jest-codemods in migration guide (#12898)
  • chore: update lockfile after release

Issues.Title: GHSA vulnerability force me to downgrade to v2.0.4
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

I came here because of this advisory:
https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cj88-88mr-972w

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Was using
    "@tailwindcss/forms": "^0.4.0",
    "@tailwindcss/typography": "^0.5.0",
    "tailwindcss": "^3.0.13"

then re-run `npm audit fix --force` changed to 
    "@tailwindcss/forms": "^0.3.4",
    "tailwindcss": "^2.0.4"
    "@tailwindcss/typography": "^0.4.1",
    
        
**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

I use django-tailwind==3.1.1 # https://github.com/timonweb/django-tailwind/releases

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

npm: 8.14.0
node is v17

**What browser are you using?**

Edge

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS but i build using docker with the image os as `FROM ubuntu:focal-20220531`

**Reproduction URL**

I don't have this sorry. I am reporting what happens when I needed to rebuild using `npm audit fix` forcing me to downgrade my tailwindcss otherwise my npm install would have failed.

**Describe your issue**

I am not sure if this is an issue?

This is my full list of current package.json

```
{
  "name": "theme",
  "version": "3.1.1",
  "description": "",
  "scripts": {
    "start": "npm run dev",
    "build": "npm run build:clean && npm run build:tailwind",
    "build:clean": "rimraf ../static/css/dist",
    "build:tailwind": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production tailwindcss --postcss -i ./src/extra-to-tailwind-styles.css -o ../static/css/dist/styles.css --minify",
    "dev": "cross-env NODE_ENV=development tailwindcss --postcss -i ./src/extra-to-tailwind-styles.css -o ../static/css/dist/styles.css -w",
    "tailwindcss": "node ./node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/cli.js"
  },
  "keywords": [],
  "author": "",
  "license": "MIT",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@tailwindcss/aspect-ratio": "^0.4.0",
    "@tailwindcss/forms": "^0.3.4",
    "@tailwindcss/line-clamp": "^0.3.1",
    "@tailwindcss/typography": "^0.4.1",
    "cross-env": "^7.0.3",
    "postcss": "^8.4.5",
    "postcss-import": "^14.0.2",
    "postcss-nested": "^5.0.6",
    "postcss-simple-vars": "^6.0.3",
    "rimraf": "^3.0.2",
    "tailwindcss": "^2.0.4"
  }
}

```

This is my git diff

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/245021/179920379-68698728-6db8-4121-8501-69d91f136f9d.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "GHSA vulnerability force me to downgrade to v2.0.4" (#8901)

Issues.Title: Cannot use bg-gradient-to-x when I set some custom 'backgroundImage' in tailwind.config.js
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.1.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

For example: postcss 8.4.14, Next.js 12.2.2 (using [this](https://github.com/ixartz/Next-js-Boilerplate) templates)

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v16.15.1

**What browser are you using?**

For example: MS Edge

**What operating system are you using?**

For example: Windows 10

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/vv2YSFrsZz

**Describe your issue**

When I set this in tailwind config:

```
backgroundImage: {
      hero: "url('/assets/images/background.jpg')",
    }
```

I can't set any gradient class for example `bg-gradient-to-t`.
Try to set a gradient class in the tailwind play.
If you remove the `backgroundImage` node in the tailwind config, the gradient intellisense appears and works.

Here's a simple demo so that I'm 100% clear :

![Animation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17864005/179834724-7831386f-1d02-4f44-8f83-9ce755a1d51d.gif)


Maybe I'm doing something wrong ?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cannot use bg-gradient-to-x when I set some custom 'backgroundImage' in tailwind.config.js" (#8899)

Issues.Title: Auto-reload not triggered upon making a change to HTML or adding Tailwind classes (unless AlpineJS script is commented out)
Issues.Body:
<!---
Thanks for filing an issue üòÑ ! Before you submit, please read the following:

Search open/closed issues before submitting since someone might have asked the same thing before!
-->

# üêõ bug report: 

Auto-reload is not triggered upon making a change to HTML or adding Tailwind classes (unless AlpineJS script is commented out)

<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue here -->

Page doesn't auto-reload after applying changes to HTML or when adding Tailwind classes. I have to reload manually to get the changes to apply. However, when I comment out the CDN from AlpineJS, it works just fine.

## üéõ Configuration (.babelrc, package.json, cli command)

<!--- If describing a bug, tell us what your babel configuration looks like -->

Here's what my package.json config looks like:

```
{
  "name": "kickoff",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "start": "parcel src/index.html --open",
    "build": "parcel build src/index.html",
    "test": "npm run eslint && echo \"‚úÖ‚úÖ‚úÖ All tests passed ‚úÖ‚úÖ‚úÖ\"",
    "eslint": "eslint --fix"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/nikoescobal/kickoff.git"
  },
  "keywords": [],
  "author": "",
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/nikoescobal/kickoff/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/nikoescobal/kickoff#readme",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/eslint-parser": "^7.18.9",
    "@parcel/css": "^1.12.0",
    "@parcel/transformer-sass": "^2.6.2",
    "eslint": "^8.20.0",
    "eslint-config-airbnb-base": "^15.0.0",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.26.0",
    "postcss-cli": "^10.0.0", 
    "tailwindcss": "^3.1.6",
    "parcel": "^2.6.2"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "alpinejs": "^3.10.2"
  }
}

```

## ü§î Expected Behavior

<!--- Tell us what should happen -->

Making to the HTML or adding Tailwind classes should automatically trigger an auto-reload from Parcel.

## üòØ Current Behavior

<!--- Tell us what happens instead of the expected behavior -->

<!--- If you are seeing an error, please include the full error message and stack trace -->

I have to manually reload for the HTML changes/Tailwind classes to apply. However, if I uncomment the AlpineJS CDN, it works just fine.

## üíÅ Possible Solution

<!--- Not obligatory, but suggest a fix/reason for the bug -->

Commenting out the AlpineJS script makes the file work, but then this defeats the purpose of being able to quickly build with both AlpineJS and TailwindCSS, given that I'll have to comment and then uncomment the CDN each time I'll be adding new methods, etc.

## üî¶ Context

<!--- How has this issue affected you? What are you trying to accomplish? -->

I'm trying to set up a template so I can easily start a project with Parcel, TailwindCSS, and AlpineJS configured. 

<!--- Providing context helps us come up with a solution that is most useful in the real world -->

## üíª Code Sample

<!-- Please provide a code repository, gist, code snippet, or sample files to reproduce the issue -->

[Link to the repo](https://github.com/nikoescobal/kickoff)

## üåç Your Environment

<!--- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->

| Software         | Version(s) |
| ---------------- | ---------- |
| TailwindCSS | ^3.1.6
| Parcel           | ^2.6.2
| Node            | v16.16.0
| npm/Yarn     | 8.5.5
| Alpine           | ^3.10.2
| Operating System | MacOS Monterey v12.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Auto-reload not triggered upon making a change to HTML or adding Tailwind classes (unless AlpineJS script is commented out)" (#8888)

Issues.Title: Escaping underscores in JavaScript contexts can cause mismatched class selectors
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.1.6 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Create React App v5.0.1 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v16.15.0 **What browser are you using?** Observed in Firefox 103 and Chrome 103 **What operating system are you using?** macOS 12.4 **Reproduction URL** https://github.com/nbrombal/tailwind-escape-conflict **Describe your issue** Tailwind's method of [escaping underscores within arbitrary values](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/content#using-spaces-and-underscores) conflicts with JavaScript when Tailwind classes are applied in a JavaScript context. For example, when using Tailwind classes in JSX as part of a ternary expression, or as a function argument for the popular [classnames](https://www.npmjs.com/package/classnames) library. This can lead to the HTML that is ultimately rendered to the page not matching the CSS that Tailwind generates. My specific situation is one where I want to use underscores in the content attribute of a pseudo-selector. In the following examples, `expand_more` is the name of an icon in [the Material Symbols icon font](https://fonts.google.com/icons), and the `font-symbols` utility applies that icon font so its ligature feature will translate the name into the icon. I'm not the first person to have run into this (that would be @FelixZY in [this discussion](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/8356)), but I don't believe the cause of this edge case has been articulated until now. ## Plain String, single escaped (working as intended) The JSX source contains a simple string for the className prop: ```jsx ``` ✓ The generated HTML class is as expected. ```html ``` ✓ The generated CSS rule is as expected. ```css .before\:content-\[\"expand\\_more\"\]::before { --tw-content: "expand_more"; content: var(--tw-content); } ``` ## JavaScript String, single escaped The JSX source uses a string in a JavaScript context (note that this runs afoul of my ESLint/Prettier config, YMMV): ```jsx /* eslint-disable no-useless-escape, prettier/prettier */ ``` ✗ Because of the JS context, the slash has been removed from the HTML class. ```html ``` ✓ The generated CSS rule is as expected, but of course it now doesn't match our slash-less HTML class. ```css .before\:content-\[\"expand\\_more\"\]::before { --tw-content: "expand_more"; content: var(--tw-content); } ``` ## JavaScript string, double escaped The JSX source uses a string in a JavaScript context: ```jsx ``` ✓ The generated HTML class is now as expected since we escaped our escape character. ```html ``` ✗ However, the generated CSS rule now incorporates the extra slashes, so it doesn't match the HTML class. ```css .before\:content-\[\"expand\\\\_more\"\]::before { --tw-content: "expand\_more"; content: var(--tw-content); } ``` This could probably be resolved by having Tailwind use a different method to escape underscores that doesn't match the way JavaScript does it. I've struggled to come up with an alternative to suggest because any option risks breaking existing content strings, but for simplicity's sake I lean towards suggesting a single underscore to represent a space (which is the current behavior), and a double underscore to represent an underscore.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Escaping underscores in JavaScript contexts can cause mismatched class selectors" (#8881)

Issues.Title: Refactor the term `whitelist` to `allowlist`
Issues.Body:
## Issue

I think it would be a good idea to start deprecating centuries old terminology that have a negative connotation associated with them.

The only term I could see in this project is "whitelist". A better term for this would be "allowlist", as it has better semantic meaning rather than relying on old metaphors.

## Suggestion

It would also be great if we could refactor the `master` branch into the now de facto `main` branch.

## Remarks

Thanks again for being one of the best frontend communities! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Refactor the term `whitelist` to `allowlist`" (#8875)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 28 commits:

  • 8.19.0
  • Build: changelog update for 8.19.0
  • feat: add importNames support for patterns in no-restricted-imports (#16059)

  • chore: correctly use .markdownlintignore in Makefile (#16060)
  • docs: make logo link clickable on small width screens (#16058)

  • chore: fix sitemap (#16026)
  • chore: remove TOC from printable (#16020)

Issues.Title: Extra table cell border in Safari
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** 3.1.6 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Next.js 12.2.2, postcss 8.4.14, autoprefixer 10.4.7 **What version of Node.js are you using?** 16.15.0 **What browser are you using?** Safari 15.5 **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/EcaFyeEx1T https://play.tailwindcss.com/1kMB78w9i0 https://codesandbox.io/s/hardcore-gwen-f7rf35?file=/pages/index.js **Describe your issue** I'm using `@tailwindcss/typography` plugin and I noticed some erroneous table cell borders appearing in Safari. As far as I can tell, this is only happening in desktop Safari. Here are some use cases: 1) Increase table font size via `prose-table:text-base` and place `

` tags inside ``: https://play.tailwindcss.com/EcaFyeEx1T 2) Place `

    ` / `
  • ` inside ``: https://play.tailwindcss.com/1kMB78w9i0 It looks like this issue has something to do with elements' margin inside ``'s. But removing the margin just makes this issue less obvious as the extra border is still there, just less visible:
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Extra table cell border in Safari" (#8869)

Issues.Title: Personal styles delete the styles of Tailwindcss
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.1.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Pug cli

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v14.8.0

**What browser are you using?**

 Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**
https://github.com/maria1186/tailwind-issue

**Describe your issue**

When I try to add my own style, in the file where I imported the Tailwindcss styles, the compiled file deleted the last written code in the Tailwindcs itself. My style is there but not on Tailwindcs.  .hidden {
  display: none;
} then there is a deleted code which is as follows @media (min-width:768px). My goal was to add a class that would center align the text. Why the class given in –¢ailwindcss doesn't work .text-center. Some overwriting is occurring.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Personal styles delete the styles of Tailwindcss" (#8860)

Issues.Title: Deleting the last styles in the compiled css, after adding my styles
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.1.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Pug cli

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v14.18.0

**What browser are you using?**

 Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

 Windows

**Reproduction URL**

A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways. Unfortunately we can't provide support without a reproduction, and your issue will be closed with no comment if this is not provided.

**Describe your issue**

Folder structure: 
  pug - This is pug template
  src - style.css ( @tailwind base;@tailwind components;@tailwind utilities;)
dist - compiled HTML file
After I add my styles after inserting Tailwind  @tailwind base;@tailwind components;@tailwind utilities;)
 I see how in src/style.css  it added my style but deleted last lines from Tailwind -By exactly this code @media (min-width: 768px){} this is completely deleted after I insert my style.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Deleting the last styles in the compiled css, after adding my styles" (#8858)

Issues.Title: Tailwind fails to compile animate-pulse: "Cannot set property 'parent' of undefined."
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/8853
Originally posted by **nataliemeurer** July 13, 2022 Hi all, My team is encountering an issue building tailwind for specific classes locally, particularly `.animate-pulse`. Here is some information on our version, setup, and error. ## Versions "postcss": "8.4.14", "tailwindcss": "^3.1.6" ## Build System We are running a create-react-app setup with craco for configuration. We are using postcss with the following craco configuration: ``` const appDirectory = fs.realpathSync(process.cwd()); const resolveApp = (relativePath) => path.resolve(appDirectory, relativePath); module.exports = { style: { postcss: { plugins: [ require('tailwindcss'), require('autoprefixer'), ], } }, plugins: [ { plugin: require('craco-babel-loader'), options: { includes: [resolveApp('../api')], }, }, ], }; ``` ## Error ``` $ tailwind build -i src/styles/index.css -o src/styles/tailwind.css üåº daisyUI components 2.13.6 ‚úîÔ∏é Including: base, components, themes[1] node:internal/process/promises:246 triggerUncaughtException(err, true /* fromPromise */); ^ TypeError: Cannot set property 'parent' of undefined at Root.removeChild (my/project/node_modules/postcss/lib/container.js:522:30) at Root.removeChild (my/project/node_modules/postcss/lib/root.js:49:45) at Proxy.remove (my/project/packages/react-app/node_modules/postcss/lib/node.js:78:19) at Rule (my/project/packages/react-app/node_modules/postcss-nested/index.js:209:43) at LazyResult.visitSync (my/project/packages/react-app/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:308:19) at LazyResult.walkSync (my/project/packages/react-app/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:297:20) at my/project/packages/react-app/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:291:39 at Root.each (my/project/node_modules/postcss/lib/container.js:105:16) at LazyResult.walkSync (my/project/packages/react-app/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:290:16) at LazyResult.sync (my/project/packages/react-app/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:247:14) { postcssNode: Rule { raws: { semicolon: true }, selector: '.animate-pulse', type: 'rule', nodes: [], parent: Root { raws: {}, type: 'root', nodes: [ AtRule { raws: {}, name: 'keyframes', params: 'pulse', type: 'atrule', nodes: [ [Rule] ], parent: [Circular *1], proxyCache: [Circular *2], lastEach: 1, indexes: {}, [Symbol(my)]: true }, [Circular *3] ], lastEach: 1, indexes: { '1': 1 }, [Symbol(my)]: true, [Symbol(isClean)]: false }, proxyCache: [Circular *3], lastEach: 1, indexes: {}, [Symbol(my)]: true, [Symbol(isClean)]: false } } error Command failed with exit code 1. ``` In other words, tailwind is working great for the majority of classes, but it's consistently failing if we add `animate-pulse` or other animations to our components. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Happy to dig in here if folks have a sense of what the issue is.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind fails to compile animate-pulse: "Cannot set property 'parent' of undefined."" (#8854)

Issues.Title: Tailwind 3.1.5 significantly increases hot module reloading times in Next.js
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** V3.1.5 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Next.js 12.2.0 **What version of Node.js are you using?** Node v16.13.2 **What browser are you using?** N/A **What operating system are you using?** MacOS **Reproduction URL** I'm not sure if it's possible to provide a reproduction URL for this issue because the project might have to be large in order for the issue to become apparent. I would be happy to help in any way I can - guidance appreciated. **Describe your issue** Upgrading from Tailwind V3.1.4 to V3.1.5 has significantly increased hot module reloading times while developing in Next.js. In our project, initial compilation goes from 5 seconds to over 20 seconds, and incremental reloads have gone from 1.5 seconds to over 10 seconds. Downgrading the Tailwind version appears to fix the problem. Before After
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tailwind 3.1.5 significantly increases hot module reloading times in Next.js" (#8845)

Issues.Title: Tailwind v3.1.5 CLI fails to install static style sheets on ubuntu stable images
Issues.Body:
Hello everyone,

I just saw this bug while trying to deploy my application in PROD. My stylesheet is generated exclusively with the tailwind CLI (installed via npx), and since I didn't specify any version on my scripts, I could notice the following regression :

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Reproduces the bugs : 3.1.5
Last known working : 3.1.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

I was using the Rust [1.62](https://hub.docker.com/layers/rust/library/rust/1.62.0/images/sha256-5709afe04a23c0a447b02077b3ab8ff3d9458e80e1f9898e40873df36a34981b?context=explore) docker image to build my style sheet, but after moving to the [22.04](https://hub.docker.com/layers/ubuntu/library/ubuntu/22.04/images/sha256-cd3d86f1fb368c6a53659d467560010ab9e0695528127ea336fe32f68f7ba09f?context=explore) ubuntu's docker image, I could see it was reproducible as well.

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

On ubuntu 22.04 : 
* npm -v :arrow_right:  v8.5.1
* node -v :arrow_right:  v12.22.9

I am not sure if it could help, but the issue isn't reproducible on my main environment with the following versions :
* npm -v :arrow_right: 6.14.17
* node -v :arrow_right: v14.20.0

**What browser are you using?**

Not related to the browser, error is thrown on install

**What operating system are you using?**

A cat on /etc/os-release on the Ubuntu latest Docker image shows : 

```
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 22.04 LTS"
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION_ID="22.04"
VERSION="22.04 LTS (Jammy Jellyfish)"
VERSION_CODENAME=jammy
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://help.ubuntu.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/"
PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy"
UBUNTU_CODENAME=jammy
```

**Reproduction URL**

The following Dockerfile is enough 

```docker
FROM ubuntu:latest

RUN apt update; apt install npm -y

WORKDIR /usr/src/myworkdir

COPY ./ .

RUN cat /etc/os-release

RUN npm -v

RUN node -v

# The commands below have been simplified in order to ignore unecessary arguments/ input parameters

# Pass with success
RUN npx tailwindcss@3.1.4 -o tailwind_3_1_4.css

# Fails
RUN npx tailwindcss@3.1.5 -o tailwind_3_1_5.css
```

**Describe your issue**

The problem is pretty simple, when we try to generate the stylesheet output in a file, the following error is thrown on version 3.1.5 : 
```
npm WARN exec The following package was not found and will be installed: tailwindcss@3.1.5
npm WARN EBADENGINE Unsupported engine {
npm WARN EBADENGINE   package: 'postcss-load-config@4.0.1',
npm WARN EBADENGINE   required: { node: '>= 14' },
npm WARN EBADENGINE   current: { node: 'v12.22.9', npm: '8.5.1' }
npm WARN EBADENGINE }
npm WARN EBADENGINE Unsupported engine {
npm WARN EBADENGINE   package: 'yaml@2.1.1',
npm WARN EBADENGINE   required: { node: '>= 14' },
npm WARN EBADENGINE   current: { node: 'v12.22.9', npm: '8.5.1' }
npm WARN EBADENGINE }
/root/.npm/_npx/b1deed7f46137711/node_modules/yaml/dist/compose/composer.js:33
                if (prelude[i + 1]?.[0] !== '#')
                                   ^

SyntaxError: Unexpected token '.'
    at wrapSafe (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:915:16)
    at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:963:27)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1027:10)
    at Module.load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:863:32)
    at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:708:14)
    at Module.require (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:887:19)
    at require (internal/modules/cjs/helpers.js:74:18)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/root/.npm/_npx/b1deed7f46137711/node_modules/yaml/dist/index.js:3:16)
    at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:999:30)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1027:10
```

From my understanding, it is indeed linked with the version of node being too low, but I find it disturbing that it is not mentionned in the repository 3.1.5 release draft ([here](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/releases/tag/v3.1.5)) besides of being a minor version change.
I believe I am not the only one to use the tool this way, hence why I prefered reporting this problem.

Thanks in advance for the hardwork you are doing and you have been doing on this nice tool that is Tailwind :smile:
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind v3.1.5 CLI fails to install static style sheets on ubuntu stable images" (#8819)

Issues.Title: Content configuration does not support exclude
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.1.5

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Angular CLI

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

16.13.1

**What browser are you using?**

 N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

 Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/cheng93/tailwind-exclude

* pull the repository
* run `ng serve`
* make a change in the spec file (src/app/app.component.spec.ts)
* you will see that the angular recompiles

Note when I changed content to `[]`, meaning it should not detect any files, changes to the spec files, does not cause a recompile.
Thus I think the issue is with tailwind (or possibly upstream lib), rather than on Angular

**Describe your issue**

Using exclusion glob, I would expect changes in excluded files to not cause a rebuild.

```js
{
  content: ["./src/**/!(*.spec).{html,ts}"]
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Content configuration does not support exclude" (#8828)

Issues.Title: All colors are missing after overriding or extending theme.colors
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.1.5

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

Node v16.16.0

**Describe your issue**

I used the Tailwindcss CLI method to setup my project.

So I'm trying to theme Tailwindcss following the example documentation from [here](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/theme), the problem is that even if I try the code snippet from the example, when I run `npx tailwindcss -i src/static/css/tailwind.css -o src/static/css/main.css` , the resulting css file doesn't contain any color related classes.

I also tried my own `tailwind.config.js` and I can't see my new color added.

**Overriding:**
```
/** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */
module.exports = {
  content: ["./src/**/templates/**/*.html}", "./src/static/js/*.js"],
  theme: {
    colors: {
        'verde': '#04DfBE'
      },
    extend: {},
  },
  plugins: [],
}
```
**Extending**
```
/** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */
module.exports = {
  content: ["./src/**/templates/**/*.html}", "./src/static/js/*.js"],
  theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        'verde': '#04DfBE'
      },
    },
  },
  plugins: [],
}
```
Neither of those will produce the classes including "verde" to be used in my theme.

Am I missing something or is this a bug?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "All colors are missing after overriding or extending theme.colors" (#8829)

Issues.Title: Handle theme keys with slashes when using `theme()` in CSS
Issues.Body: Fixes #8824

Adding following styles to css leads to an error:

```
.test {
  --shadow: theme("boxShadow.glow-8/28/20");
  box-shadow: var(---shadow);
}
```

error:
```
'boxShadow.glow-8/28' does not exist in your theme config. Did you mean 'boxShadow.glow-8/28/20'?
```

v3.1.5

NextJS 12.1.0

v16.2.0

**What browser are you using?**

N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/xlki3pMe9n?file=css

**Describe your issue**

Adding styles that contain more than one forward slash `/` returns an error when it's used via `theme()` function, for example: `theme("boxShadow.glow-6/30/40")`

Issues.Title: Output styles not generated other then for html files
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/8823
Originally posted by **franferns** July 11, 2022 I have a simple set up for adding tailwind css for non html files. The extension am supporting is aspx. The issue is that the output styles are not generated. I have a folder with two files in a folder src SimpleErrorView.aspx and SimpleErrorView.html below is the set up i run ``` npm init -y npm install -D tailwindcss npx tailwindcss init ``` Here's a video of the issue https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/779253/178157445-635aaac7-97a4-4533-9533-da6999d1e578.mp4 The output.css file does not generate any styles when the Content is set to SimpleErrorView.aspx . The same set up works when i change the content in the tailwind.config.js to an html file. SimpleErrorView.html. Is there something that I am missing to get the styles properly generated ? Thanks & Regards, Francis P.

Issues.Title: [Feature] Add `grid-rows-fill`, `grid-rows-fit`, `grid-cols-fill`, and `grid-cols-fit` utilities
Issues.Body:
## Issue

There was no clean way to specify `auto-fill` or `auto-fit` inside a grid template CSS property.

## Background

When #1403, this was not a real feasible solution before the JIT compiler. However, generating these styles on the fly shouldn't have nearly the performance hit as it did before.

Further discussions have been made in #8705

## Changes

I added `grid-rows-fill-*`, `grid-rows-fit-*`, `grid-cols-fill-*`, and `grid-cols-fit-*` to our utilities. The default values are all derived from `theme('spacing')` and arbitrary values will populate correctly with minimum syntax required.

## Example Syntax

| Class | Value |
| ----------- | ----------- |
| `grid-rows-fill-16`      | `grid-template-rows: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(4rem, 1fr))`       |
| `grid-rows-fill-[200px]`      | `grid-template-rows: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(200px, 1fr))`       |
| `grid-cols-fill-20`   | `grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(5rem, 1fr))`        |
| `grid-cols-fill-[300px]`      | `grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(300px, 1fr))`       |
| `grid-rows-fit-24`      | `grid-template-rows: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(6rem, 1fr))`       |
| `grid-rows-fit-[400px]`      | `grid-template-rows: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(400px, 1fr))`       |
| `grid-cols-fit-28`   | `grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(7rem, 1fr))`        |
| `grid-cols-fit-[500px]`   | `grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(500px, 1fr))`        |

## Remarks

Again, thank you for making a beautiful tool. This is my favorite tool to advocate for ‚ù§Ô∏è .

If you have any comments/suggestions, I would love to hear your feedback.

Thanks again.
